Currently developing web application training tools (Implementing progressive web App technology) for staff working at IBM locations across Ireland and the uk - with the end goal of making learning fast and easy, and augmenting the user's ability to work more efficiently with less stress.Researching ways to integrate technology - specifically web based technologies - into the physical security sector (applying progressive web app technology to solve security problems - there's so much potential enhancement and possible progression we can achieve with the technology already available).General Security and administration. Using Microsoft office, cctv systems, CAS (control access systems). Supporting other staff from a central control room.

Working mostly on front end development, taking a zen approach to user experience and to meticulously refactoring my code. "Less is more" would sum up my approach to UX and web design, with the idea that every element on the page has a purpose and function that leads the user toward a specific goal.

Helping kids to see their potential and to bloom into level headed, and quietly confident, adults. Developing a child's fine motor skills, balance and spacial awareness. And encouraging intuition, self awareness, social awareness, self expression and leadership. The mundane stuff: Tax returns, child protection policy writing, record keeping.

Teaching the discipline of Jujutsu at an international level to adults and children. Helping people realise their physical and mental potential.Areas covered: self defence, weapons training, close quarter combat, situational awareness,  anatomical weak points, combat psychology, meditation, fitness training, spatial awareness. And the list goes on.

A self paced interactive course teaching JavaScript full stack development. The course covers the following in great detail: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, algorithms,  APIs, jQuery, design, testing, security, responsive design, D3js, reactjs, redux, node, express, nosql databases, deployment.A number of projects (putting your study and practice to the test) must be built in each section of the course in order to receive the cert for that section. Each of the three sections comprises of 400 hours of practice and challenges. Plus the final section which consists 800 hours of working on four real world projects for non profit organisations.

summary: Using my natural creativity to solve real world problems - that's my thing.Things I love to do: learn, create, breathe (breathing is underrated), solve problems.I'm a mostly self taught web developer. Things like data structures and algorithms excite me! I'm assuming it's normal for web developers to get excited about that type of thing.... I can't be the only one (granted, I am socially awkward and better at interacting with technology than with people).Typing a few lines of code and seeing it come to life, in the form of a mobile or web application, is a magical thing for me. I spend at least 5 hours a day coding.... with my laptop in one hand and my 2 year old daughter in the other. She needs a lot of attention, but then again so does my daughter!If you have any ideas that you think I could help you with, feel free to get in touch. You can get me at: kpcurtis@gmail.comMy ever expanding skill set includes: Front end technologies:  HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, Jquery, ReactJS, Redux, knockoutJs, backbone, Bootstrap. Back end technologies: PHP, NodeJS. Databases: MySQL, SQLite, mongoDB.Mobile technologies: Java, XML, Android studio. I also have a keen interest in user experience, ethical hacking, and digital marketing.
